name: fdsnws-event Web Service
description: The fdsnws-event web service returns event (earthquake) information from catalogs originating from the NEIC and the ISC data centers. Events may be selected based on location, time, catalog, contributor and internal identifiers. By default, events are retrieved from the NEIC PDE catalog for recent events and then the ISC catalog when it becomes available. These default results include only that catalog’s “primary origin” and “primary magnitude” for each event, they may optionally include all available magnitude estimates.  By default results are returned as XML in QuakeML format (schema), but may also be requested in text formats.

potentialAction.name: Query
potentialAction.description: query service to obtain records of seismic events

result.description: XML, csv, or csv fromat for seismic event following EarthCube geoWs conventions.

target.description: URL with multiple query parameters--geographic location, event depth, time period of event, event magnitude, source network, miscellaneous parameters, formt for returned data, and what flat to use for no data.  TBD-- how to handle POST request version; need to specify the format for the POST content

uriTemplate-input.description: allowed: Any valid time. Limit to events on or after the specified start time; use UTC for time zone
allowed: Any valid time. Limit to events on or before the specified start time
Limit to events with a latitude larger than or equal to the specified minimum. Value must be less that maxlat
Limit to events with a latitude smaller than or equal to the specified minimum. Value must be greater than minlat
Limit to events with a longitude larger than or equal to the specified minimum. Value must be less than maxlon; longitude east of 0 degrees is <0
Limit to events with a longitude smaller than or equal to the specified maximum.
Specify the latitude to be used for a radius search.
Specify the longitude to be used for a radius search.
Limit to events within the specified minimum number of degrees from the geographic point defined by the latitude and longitude parameters.
Limit to events within the specified maximum number of degrees from the geographic point defined by the latitude and longitude parameters.
Limit to events with depth more than the specified minimum
Limit to events with depth less than the specified minimum
Limit to events with a magnitude greater than the specified maximum.
Limit to events with a magnitude smaller than the specified maximum.
Specify a magnitude type to use for testing the minimum and maximum limits
Limit to events with a specified eventType. The parameter value can be a single item, a comma-separated list of items.
Specify if all origins for the event should be included, default is data center dependent but is suggested to be the preferred origin only.
Specify if all magnitudes for the event should be included, default is data center dependent but is suggested to be the preferred magnitude only.
Specify if phase arrivals should be included.
Select a specific event by ID; event identifiers are data center specific.

object.description: description of the resource that the target request operates on; it might have a information model that is implemented by the target urlTemplate parameters. DataFeed is probably not the best type

variableMeasured.name: name of the variable
variableMeasured.description: example of documentation for a varible provided in the result object
variableMeasured.propertyID: URI for the property in some ontology
variableMeasured.measurementTechnique: URI for the measurement protocol, or text description of procedure and sensor
